coverAlt: A closeup of pink and white roses from above
title: How to Do Nothing
subTitle: Resisting the Attention Economy
author: Jenny Odell
description: Written by an artist who draws from history to understand how we can live a more purposeful life. The provocative title actually implies a balance we need to achieve and the necessity of missing out.

coverAlt: An illustration of a mouse in a red cape riding on the back of a crow
title: Mrs. Frisby and the Rats of NIMH
author: Robert C. O'Brien
description: Adding some books that I am reading to my child. This is one that I was very excited to share with her.

coverAlt: An illustration of a man dressed in a suit and 2 limurs are sitting around him
title: Creativity
subTitle: A Short and Cheerful Guide
author: John Cleese
description: Creativity is not a skill or a talent… it is simply an ability to play and get into a mindset where we trust our own ideas and instincts.

coverAlt: Large blog letters that say you got this with a cat running around causing trouble
title: The Independence Issue
subTitle: June 2024
author: Various
description: Super excited to share something newsprint with my daughter. This fun gift also has a lot of helpful advise that parents are not supposed to read.

coverAlt: Large geometric letters and a small pixel character falling down a screen
title: Ready Player Two
subTitle: A Novel
author: Ernest Cline
description: Accessible science fiction. Full of nostalgia for the 1980s. Don't listen to harsh reviews. This is a fun rewarding read like its predecessor.

coverAlt: Cover that mentions 4 million copies sold and #1 NYT bestselling author
title: Strengths Finder 2.0
author: Tom Rath
description: “You cannot be anything you want to be – but you can be a lot more of who you already are.” Are you the personality that enjoy’s personality tests? This one is a cool and positive perspective and great to complete as a team.

coverAlt: A bold book cover that lists the title and and illustration of a knight saying NYT Bestseller
title: Martyr
subTitle: A Novel
author: Kaveh Akbar
description: I am reading this book because it has a very good looking cover and it was included in the recent NY Times 100 Best Books of the 21st Century
